Package controller

Class AdminDisplayController

java.lang.Object
controller.AdminDisplayController
public class AdminDisplayController extends Object
controller to manage admin functions like adding and deleting users
Author:
jason dao, ryan coslove

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addUser()
    adds user if input from alert dialog is valid (name cannot previously exist, cannot be blank input, cannot make another admin)
    void
    deleteUser()
    deletes user admin chooses in listview with confirmation
    void
    getList(SaveData s, javafx.collections.ObservableList<PhotoLib> a)
    sets up scene by choosing first user and getting list of users as well as storing data locally and savedata object locally
    void
    logout(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
    logs out of admin page and goes back to login.fmxl and photoscontroller

    sets the stage to the scene connected to this controller

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws IOException
      sets the stage to the scene connected to this controller
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - stage of scene
      Throws:
      IOException - in case it cannot find scene

    • addUser

      public void addUser() throws IOException
      adds user if input from alert dialog is valid (name cannot previously exist, cannot be blank input, cannot make another admin)
      Throws:
      IOException - in case alertbox data does not come back

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser() throws IOException
      deletes user admin chooses in listview with confirmation
      Throws:
      IOException - in case alert does not come back

    • logout

      public void logout(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      logs out of admin page and goes back to login.fmxl and photoscontroller
      Parameters:
      e - triggers when logout button is pressed
      Throws:
      IOException - in case it does not get input of button pressed

    • getList

      public void getList(SaveData s, javafx.collections.ObservableList<PhotoLib> a)
      sets up scene by choosing first user and getting list of users as well as storing data locally and savedata object locally
      Parameters:
      s - savedata object to store
      a - list of users
